summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from September 2019 discussing the process for obtaining a letter from the SDNY (Southern District of New York) to support victim compensation applications for Epstein victims. The emails show coordination between FBI victim specialists and the Office of Victim Services (OVS) following Epstein's death.

persons.name: Cronin
persons.context: An OVS representative who indicates that victim compensation may be possible if a letter is obtained from a DA or AUSA stating they would have prosecuted if the case had been brought timely.

events.title: OVS inquiry about victim compensation
events.description: An FBI Victim Specialist emails an OVS representative to ask if Epstein victims can still apply for compensation even though they disclosed years after the abuse.

events.title: Request to push letter request to SDNY
events.description: An FBI email chain forwards a request from the FBI Victim Services Division to push a request for a prosecution letter to the SDNY to support victim compensation.

events.title: Internal FBI follow-up on victim letter
events.description: Internal FBI emails show follow-up on obtaining a letter from the SDNY for victim compensation, noting a need to close the loop and ensure the victim specialist doesn't think the ball is in the FBI's court.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively working with victim specialists to secure compensation for Epstein victims through the Office of Victim Services (OVS) in September 2019.
Compensation eligibility hinged on obtaining a letter from the SDNY (District Attorney or AUSA) stating they would have prosecuted the case if it had been brought in a timely manner.
The email chain indicates frustration and urgency, with an OVS representative stating 'I'm so angry about what happened over the weekend,' likely referencing Epstein's death in August 2019.
The communication shows internal FBI coordination between the New York Field Office and the FBI Victim Services Division regarding victim support logistics.
